abstracts.cdata!:
The project has three main objectives.
            The first is to design and implement transport sector policy
            reforms, in particular through: (a) a program of regulatory
            and institutional reform to improve the management of the
            national road network and to put the financing of roads on a
            sustainable long-term basis, and (b) enhanced opportunities
            for private sector participation in the rehabilitation and
            maintenance of roads.  The second objective is to strengthen
            the government's capacity to plan and coordinate public
            expenditures for roads, and to monitor sector performance.
            The third is to carry out the preparatory engineering work
            for the first year program of a proposed multi-year Roads
            Rehabilitation Project (RRP).  The project will finance
            technical assistance and studies which, taken together,
            will:  (a) provide the elements required for creating a
            sustainable, efficient system for managing roads; and (b)
            prepare the first year of the proposed RRP.  The project
            contains the following components:  policy support; project
            preparation; and institutional development.
